title: Thunderbird we are unable to bypass the CheckLoadURIError
content:
Hello, we followed the hint at this page to enable the local links:

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Links_to_local_pages_do_not_work#Thunderbird_1.5,_SeaMonkey_1.0_and_newer

In email message our links are the typical UNC path "\\<server>\share\file" linked in the complete URI "file://///<server>/share/file" Our config is the same as the example in the previuos page. In the "capability.policy.policynames.localfilelinks.sites" we set our imap://<fqdnimapservername>:<port>. Also we tried with imap://<username%40domain>@<fqdnimapservername>:<port>: nothing changed. We obtained the full -previous- string in the error console (CTRL+SHIFT+J). Everytime we test it we got the CheckLoadURIError (Security Error) in the error console.

Previous we were able to unlock local links in Firefox with the same method. Anyway with thunderbird we are unable to bypass this security check.

What we are doing wrong? How could we solve?
creator: silvano4

title: cannot access gmail
content:
Attempts to use Thunderbird to read my gmail have been failing for the last several months.

When Thunderbird tries to get mail from my account, instead a Google help web page (https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050?hl=en) pops up in a window that appears to be a Thunderbird window titled, "Enter credentials for [my gmail account] on imap.gmail.com". That page has a button to sign in with my Google account, but hitting that button simply brings up the same Google help web page.

I've tried deleting my gmail account from Thunderbird and re-adding that account as a new account. That just gets me to the same page.

The web page refers to Troubleshoot issues with Google Accounts > Clear cache & cookies

It appears to be focused on accessing Gmail from a browser such as Firefox. I don't understand how to translate that advice to doing something with Thunderbird.

I have the impression that the problem has to do with a GMail having moved to a different version of the IMAP protocol.

Right now, I've done an awkward work-around it by going into GMail on a browser and setting it to forward all my gmail to another email account of mine that does work with Thunderbird. However, I'm getting ready to just give up and move all my mail to a different mailer.

Has anyone got a fix for this?
